Prince of Songkla University: Prince of Songkla University (PSU; Thai: มหาวิทยาลัยสงขลานครินทร์; RTGS: Mahawitthayalai Songkhla Nakharin) is the first university in southern Thailand, established in 1967.[3] The name of the university was granted by the King Bhumibol Adulyadej in honor of  Prince Mahidol Adulyadej, Prince of Songkla, the King's father.
